item.title: Cloudflare Analytics review
item.content:encoded: Disclaimer 1: I’m working on Plausible Analytics, a simple, lightweight, open-source and privacy-friendly alternative to Google Analytics. Disclaimer 2: Cloudflare reached out in July saying they’d “love to chat”. It all started with this tweet by Matthew Prince. We were upfront that we’re not looking to sell or get funded and answered their questions about… Continue reading Cloudflare Analytics review

item.title: 13% of my website visitors block Google Analytics
item.content:encoded: There’s widespread use of adblockers on the web but users are increasingly blocking cookies and other tracking scripts too. Browsers such as Safari, Firefox and Brave are privacy-focused. Many users install additional plugins such as uBlock Origin to better protect themselves. Is Google Analytics still efficient considering the blocking rate? How big is the data… Continue reading 13% of my website visitors block Google Analytics

item.title: Only 9% of visitors give GDPR consent to be tracked
item.content:encoded: Privacy regulations such as the GDPR say that you need to seek permission from your website visitors before tracking them. Most GDPR consent banner implementations are deliberately engineered to be difficult to use and are full of dark patterns that are illegal according to the law. I wanted to find out how many visitors would… Continue reading Only 9% of visitors give GDPR consent to be tracked

item.title: How you can help keep blogging alive and thriving
item.content:encoded: I was happy to see some posts about blogging being widely discussed over the last few days. A couple of them that I wanted to highlight are “If I could bring one thing back to the internet it would be blogs” and “Blogging is not dead“. I’m a blogger myself and have been blogging for… Continue reading How you can help keep blogging alive and thriving

item.title: How to fix the broken web as a site owner and web developer
item.content:encoded: Yesterday there was a lively discussion on Hacker News and different Subreddits around cookie consent walls not being valid according to the GDPR. Ironically, when visiting the article discussed, I was faced with one of the worst and most user-hostile implementations of the cookie law. The web is broken. Behavioral tracking without consent, abuse of… Continue reading How to fix the broken web as a site owner and web developer

item.title: Please get your parents off Facebook
item.content:encoded: The internet is a tool that has democratized content publishing. It has made information free and enabled anyone to publish whatever they want, share their beliefs and gain a following. This is amazing if you use it for good. Facebook has lowered the bar to share ideas as low as it can get and now… Continue reading Please get your parents off Facebook

item.title: How to de-Google your site to make it faster and visitor friendly
item.content:encoded: Did you know that 94% of sites include at least one third-party resource while the median page requests content from 9 different domains? These third-party resources represent 35% of the total network activity and 7 of the 10 most used resources are owned by Google. Third-party resources slow down the web and are a concern… Continue reading How to de-Google your site to make it faster and visitor friendly

item.title: Ethical marketing in the GDPR, CCPA and no third-party cookies world
item.content:encoded: Marketers live in the world of data privacy regulations such as GDPR and CCPA, and the world where browsers block third-party cookie-based tracking. Here’s how you can grow your site and startup by practicing ethical marketing. And it’s only going to get more challenging with further regulations to be expected. You may be gradually getting… Continue reading Ethical marketing in the GDPR, CCPA and no third-party cookies world

item.title: Use Firefox Preview to make browsing on Android fast and distraction-free
item.content:encoded: Firefox for Android just got much better. Mozilla did a complete rewrite and has created a new generation of Firefox (Preview) that’s much more consistent with Firefox desktop experience. This post is a detailed look at Firefox Preview which when fully matured will replace the Firefox Android mobile app. A faster and more pleasant, distraction-free… Continue reading Use Firefox Preview to make browsing on Android fast and distraction-free

item.title: How to fight back against Google AMP
item.content:encoded: There’s a popular thread on Hacker News with lots of people complaining about how Google AMP (Accelerated Mobile Pages) is ruining their mobile web experience. Here’s what’s wrong with using Google AMP. This week I also got two AMP links sent to me via Telegram and to see those Google URLs replacing unique domain names… Continue reading How to fight back against Google AMP
